relation: The campus have a great diversity of cafeterias and fast food restaurants.

They have two residence halls, one inside the campus and the other outside the campus. These two are design to receive students with economic need. There is another residence of three buildings outside the campus with great facilities like internet service in all the rooms, laundry, games room, study room.
It's very competitive, the professors motivate the students to be better each semester. It's hard to get your degree with a good GPA but they encourage you to achieve it.
100% Recommended. Very competitive. Great professors. Great research opportunities.
The best university in the country. Prepare their students with a great general education besides their major. Graduate great professionals.

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Wildaly from Guayama, PR 12/28/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 1 out of 1 people found this review useful. 2 of 43 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Anyone who would like to get to know Puerto Rico and take advantage of its wonders. The academic offerings are vast and the university is located at the heart of Rio Piedras, which is basically kept alive by the university community. Tips for prospective students Be aware that you have to have a working knowledge of Spanish as almost all courses are given in that language (except English and foreign languages majors, of course). There's a decent population, however, of foreign students who study in the Natural Sciences faculty and I've noticed many of them don't know much Spanish. Still, if you want to get to know the locals, knowing Spanish definitely helps (although many Puerto Ricans in the metropolitan area DO know English). Bang for the buck
